title: Second Fact Checking!
body:
"I just wanted to create a list of 'facts' pertaining to in-game behavior and ask that if any are erroneous, please correct them. Examples for clarification would be welcome. The why doesn't matter here, just the facts. The intent is not to open a discussion to opinions on what is good or bad, just the facts. Morality, good strategy and etiquette are irrelevant in this thread. It's not meant as an exhaustive list of all things behavior, but if anyone wants to add to the list, feel free, so long as its with the intent to be sure that your facts are correct, and not to make a player's version of the code of conduct."

In the last couple months, I've had a few potential revelations pertaining to the behavior system's rules based on discussions on this forum. [First Fact Checking list here, linking only for the curious.](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/LAH6Tnzy-fact-checking)

1. A single ZT phrase is all that's needed to be punished for ZT phrases. (How enforceable it is, is not the question; it is the rule that matters in this thread.)
2. You must always play to win. (2 and 3 are not exclusive, but only one is absolutely correct.)
*2a.  I define playing to win as pursuing objectives AND resources to destroy the enemy nexus. 
3. You must never play to lose.
*3a. I define playing to lose as not contributing to the destruction of the enemy nexus, offensively (faster than they get yours) OR defensively (by obstructing them from getting yours).
4. Farming lane(s) and towers while avoiding everything else is not inting, as long as the lane(s) get pushed to threaten towers/inhibs/nexus.
5. You may [discuss](https://www.google.com/search?client=firefox-b-1-d&sxsrf=ALeKk03-ecZ142nQtUFLDQgeVHIIGTXe4g%3A1582859019690&ei=C4NYXtLqKc72-gT7rqjYCw&q=discuss&oq=discuss&gs_l=psy-ab.3..0i67i70i249j0i67l2j0l7.17851.18813..19137...0.2..0.81.518.7......0....1..gws-wiz.......0i71j35i39j0i131j0i10.aTqMmLCgN-A&ved=0ahUKEwiSnOSsofPnAhVOu54KHXsXCrsQ4dUDCAo&uact=5), *but not [argue](https://www.google.com/search?client=firefox-b-1-d&sxsrf=ALeKk01cbKsY-RNMSRmmyridYXI9AYm6Ug%3A1582859004896&ei=_IJYXsSkNsXh-gS-rbeQAg&q=argue&oq=argue&gs_l=psy-ab.3..0i67i70i249j0i273l2j0i67l2j0l2j0i10j0j0i10.12567.13554..13783...0.2..0.97.429.5......0....1..gws-wiz.......0i71j0i131j35i39.JmjvEk8FXoI&ved=0ahUKEwjEkt2lofPnAhXFsJ4KHb7WDSIQ4dUDCAo&uact=5),* aspects of the game. (Very important to distinguish that this is NOT etiquette, but the RULE on behavior.)
6. You can defend yourself and/or others in chat.
7. You may not retaliate in game. 
8. You may discredit allies. 
*Example: Leona repeatedly makes bad engages, blaming you as Ezreal for not being aggressive enough. You cannot say Leona doesn't understand that she's losing by making stupid engages, but can say you won't engage if she initiates without the JG. Leona continues to make bad engages into mid game, still blaming you for not having enough damage. Again you may not say that was her fault for feeding the enemy Draven, but you may encourage the team to disregard Leona's initiations, declaring that you will have better chances as a 4v5 than if she keeps initiating teamfights.

*edit: bonus example: The Leona may defend herself by saying she did make a bad engage, but would like to see Ezreal focus Draven because their Lux can't hit the broad side of a barn, so they can turn it around. Subsequently she can say she thought the team would win the fight by taking down Draven (let's say they did but it was Draven dead to all 5 dead on Leona's team) and she'll be more reactionary and will avoid initiating.

replies.body: You can condense half of these into "Don't use chat to derail the game."

So you would be affirming #5-8, then. I know you're big on going against anything that derails. I'd make it #9: Don't derail the game. This would add to 5, 6, and 8, essentially saying "keep it short". Remember, this isn't supposed to be a "player's rulebook", I'm just checking what is a correct understanding and what isn't.

Yeah, I have a low tolerance for horseshit, and arguing with idiots is pointless. I don't understand the overall desire for people to have to prove a point to internet strangers they're never going to see again. "Reeeeee, he started it, I was defending myself!" Mute the fucking idiot, who cares what he thinks.

I would have to go into one of my nauseatingly positive rants about how being a saint to your peers and doing all you can to encourage them to win... because /mute all is not the only answer, especially for those of us who are under the punishment radar.

But that's a totally derailing thing to get into, just care about the rules 'ere. I know most behavior nerds can't/won't/abhor that kind of approach anyway. Yeah, we're behavior nerds.
Never forget the third option - neutrality. We don't have to be fakely positive to our teammates, but we don't have to be assholes either.

You're correct on "only one ZT phrase". The automated system gives players leeway - but human review does not. This is to prevent players from being punished for saying it once as an accident/non-toxic way.

[The automated system might be deliberately made differently.](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/bBMawHjF-tell-me-again-the-ifs-works?comment=000200000000) If that's the case... are we actually sure of that?

I don’t think anyone knows what the exact criteria are, but it seems that players who say it once (or even twice) and legitimately did not know it was against the rules would have their punishment reduced to a chat restrictions by support. I suppose this is why the automated system is the way it is in that it doesn’t instantly punish after the game for everyone who says one - only in certain cases will that result in an instant punishment.

5 is a bit vague. Discuss and argue can be seen as the same thing. I think the issue is more arguing about things that are not aspects of the game itself. You can argue strategy, as in one person has a plan, someone else has another plan, and you argue briefly over what to do. But arguing over whos toxic, whos feeding, in other words; things that are not aspects of the game itself, are punishable.

Im glad you said so!
The difference between arguing and discussing is straightforward: arguing is trying to convince another to accept something, while discussing is simply stating something.

 In discussing strategy, one party states a strategy, and another May state another strategy. If one is "everyone push mid", the other may say "teamfights aren't going well, I'll split push."

Arguing would continue that: "but we can win under tower, you're not a good split push champion." It could be right, but at that point the 1st party is trying to convince the other that they are correct.

Further discussing it would be: "it will be desperate without you. We'll do our best."
